ASE-BOOSE-DOC
Table of Contents

Namespace Booseapp

Classes

AppArray

Represents an application-defined array variable/command that can store either integer or real values. This class acts as both the "array" declaration command and the stored variable instance in the program.

AppAssign

Represents a runtime assignment command that updates an existing variable by evaluating an expression at execution time.

AppBoolean

Represents an application-defined boolean variable/command. Inherits from BOOSE.Evaluation so it can be stored as a variable and used in expressions.

AppCall

Represents the call command, which invokes a user-defined method. It evaluates argument expressions, assigns them to the method's parameter variables, stores a return address, and transfers execution to the method body.

AppCanvas

Represents a drawable canvas used in the Boose application. Provides methods to draw shapes, set pen properties, and manage drawing state.

AppCircle

Represents a command that draws a circle on the canvas. Evaluates the supplied parameter at runtime and uses it as the circle radius.

AppCommandFactory

Factory class responsible for creating instances of application-specific commands. Inherits from BOOSE.CommandFactory and overrides the MakeCommand(string) method to return corresponding command objects based on the command name.

AppElse

Represents the else part of an if/else block. This is a compound command that links to the corresponding if and the final end.

AppEnd

Represents the end marker command used to close compound blocks such as if, else, for, while, and method. During compilation it links the corresponding opening command to its end line. During execution it performs any required control-flow (looping or method return).

AppFor

Represents a for loop command. Parses loop syntax, initialises the loop variable, evaluates range/step, and controls program flow until the corresponding end for is reached.

AppIf

Represents an if conditional command. Evaluates a boolean expression and controls program flow by jumping to the matching else or end if marker when the condition is false.

AppInt

Represents an application-defined integer variable/command. Inherits from BOOSE.Evaluation so it can be declared, stored, and used in expressions.

AppMethod

Represents a user-defined method declaration command. A method defines a return variable, optional typed parameters, and a body that is executed via call. When encountered during normal execution flow, the method body is skipped.

AppMoveto

Represents a command that moves the pen to a specified position on the canvas. Inherits from BOOSE.CommandTwoParameters and requires two integer parameters (X and Y coordinates).

AppParser

Application-specific parser that extends the BOOSE BOOSE.Parser to support runtime assignment handling and special-case parsing needed by the application.

AppPeek

Represents the peek command, which reads a value from an array element and stores it into a destination variable.

AppPoke

Represents the poke command, which writes a value into an array element. Supports both integer and real arrays and allows row/column indices to be expressions.

AppReal

Represents an application-defined real (double) variable/command. Inherits from BOOSE.Evaluation so it can be declared, stored, and used in expressions.

AppRect

Represents a command that draws a rectangle on the canvas. Inherits from BOOSE.CommandTwoParameters and requires two integer parameters (width and height).

AppSet

Represents the set command, which assigns the result of an expression to an existing variable at runtime. Supports integer, real, and boolean variables.

AppStoredProgram

Application-specific implementation of BOOSE.StoredProgram. Adds method support (register/call/return) and provides overrides for updating and retrieving application variable types (real/boolean) as well as expression evaluation cleanup.

AppWhile

Represents a while loop command. Evaluates a boolean expression and controls program flow by exiting the loop when the condition becomes false.

AppWrite

Represents the write command, which evaluates an expression (including string expressions) and writes the resulting text to the canvas.

CanvasException

Represents errors that occur during canvas operations such as drawing or rendering. Inherits from the base Exception class.

Form1

Represents the main form of the Boose application. Handles initialization, user interactions, and drawing operations on the canvas.

Made with docfx
